intro: Microchilus plowmanii, commonly known as the Plowman's microchilus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a central disc of darker florets. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
